did.head: Descriptive Summary

langmaterial.language: The language of the materials is English

did.abstract: Material in this collection relates to Sacred Heart church, the oldest Polish American parish in New Britain Connecticut, established in 1894. It was an ethnic parish lead by the very powerful Monsignor Lucyan Bojnowski who was was a very influential figure not only for parishioners’ lives but the entire town. Paul Wysocki, served as pastor of the parish during the years 1977-2003. These years were very important to the ethnic parish. In the 1980’s a new wave of political immigrants came to the city from Poland (a result of Solidarity immigration) and wanted to participate and to receive services they were used to in Poland. However, some actions created frictions between the old and the new Polonia. There were questions of church financial contributions, ownership of the church, and who should make or advice pastors on changes within the parish. This collection concentrates on the post solidarity immigrants and controversies within the church from the 1980’s till mid 1990’s.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Part of the material that is restricted was given to the archives by Prof. Daniel S. Buczek in 2004 with restriction on access for the 10 years, therefore collection will be available for full research in 2014. Prof.Buczek had written a book on the history of Sacred Heart titled: People of God : a centennial history of Sacred Heart of Jesus Parish, New Britain, Connecticut. Second part of the material was given to the archives in January 2008 without any restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with some restrictions. Part of the material in the collection is restricted and sealed till 2014. Two scrapbooks and folders related to Sacred Heart cemetery controversy in mid 1980’s is available and open for research.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Sacred Heart church is the oldest Polish American parish in New Britain Connecticut, established in 1894. It was an ethnic parish lead by the very powerful Monsignor Lucyan Bojnowski who was a very influential figure not only for parishioners’ lives but influenced the entire town. Paul Wysocki served as pastor of the parish during the years 1977-2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of two sealed envelopes with restricted material related to church controversy during Rev. Paul Wysocki's appointment as a Pastor of the Sacred Heart church in New Britain, Connecticut. Remaining folders are related to a cemetery controversy, consisting of correspondence with church officials and attorneys for the defendant Paul Wysocki and the plaintiff the Grygorcewicz family. Material covers years 1983-1994. Two scrapbooks contain variety of material related to the church, immigrants in New Britain area and previous pastors of the church that cover years from 1916 till 1994.
